dt: {bc}a procedural plan that indicates the time and sequence of each operation
{bc}a written or printed list, catalog, or inventory
{bc}a body of items to be dealt with {bc}{sx|agenda||}
{bc}a statement of supplementary details appended to a legal or legislative document
{bc}a governmental list of drugs all subject to the same legal restrictions and controls
usually used with a Roman numeral I to V indicating decreasing potential for abuse or addiction

et: Middle English, from Medieval Latin {it}scedula{/it} slip, page, charter, from Late Latin {it}schedula{/it} slip of paper, diminutive of Latin {it}*scheda{/it} strip of papyrus, probably back-formation from Latin {it}schedium{/it} impromptu speech, from Greek {it}schedion{/it}, from neuter of {it}schedios{/it} casual; akin to Greek {it}schedon{/it} near at hand, {it}echein{/it} to seize, have
shortdef: program; especially : a procedural plan that indicates the time and sequence of each operation
a written or printed list, catalog, or inventory; also : timetable
a body of items to be dealt with : agenda

dt: {bc}to appoint, assign, or designate for a fixed time

shortdef: to appoint, assign, or designate for a fixed time

dt: {bc}doing or finishing something earlier than planned

dt.t: The builders came in {it}ahead of schedule{/it}, and we are now able to move in.

shortdef: doing or finishing something earlier than planned

dt: {bc}doing or finishing something later than planned

dt.t: If we get too far {it}behind/off schedule{/it} we will not be able to catch up later.

shortdef: later than planned : doing or finishing something later than planned

dt.t: We're running about five minutes {it}behind schedule{/it}.
The project is {it}going according to schedule{/it}.

shortdef: at the time expected : on time

dt: {bc}to arrive and/or leave later than the time that is expected
{bc}to do something or happen later than planned or expected or to take longer than planned or expected

dt.t: The doctor's appointments are {it}running behind schedule{/it} today.
The doctor is {it}running behind schedule{/it} today.

shortdef: to arrive and/or leave later than the time that is expected
to do something or happen later than planned or expected or to take longer than planned or expected

dt: {bc}a small amount of time to do something

dt.t: We have a {it}tight schedule{/it} to get this project done.

shortdef: a small amount of time to do something

dt.t: It can automatically silence incoming calls and alerts, either during {wi}prescheduled{/wi} times or on demand.
